free_text.Learning outcomes: To learn the essentials of structures, properties and applications of ceramics and other functional materials. To be able to explain the relations between structures and properties as well as the similarity and the differences between the main properties of ceramics and non-ceramic materials.
free_text.Content: 1. Important crystalline structures of ceramics.[br/]2. Point defects and their importance.[br/]3. Phase equilibria in ceramics[br/]4. Electrical, dielectric and optical properties.[br/]5. Mechanical and thermal properties.[br/]6. Experimental characterisation of properties of ceramics[br/]7. Analysis of experimental results[br/]8. Practice with instruments for electromechanical measurements[br/]
free_text.Form of examination: The final grade is attributed based on the grade of the final exam (75%) and the average grade of the TP reports (25%).
free_text.Note: Subjects examined : the entire content of the lectures and the knowledge aquired during the experimental work.[br/]

Propriétés électriques, diélectriques et optiques.[br/]5. Propriétés mécaniques et thermiques.[br/]6. La pratique dans la caractérisation des propriétés des céramiques[br/]7.
